comment: Wali strasznie torfem delikatna w smaku intensywna w zapachu finisz sredni
Do you want smoke? This has smoke. Do you want peat? This has peat? A brash commercial entry into a sublime genre.
Finishes a bit spicier than Ardbeg, but has similar notes... A nice blend (and value) for those who like intense smoke and peat.
Smokey peat with a very dry finish.

Great Islay taste with a friendly price tag. 
Smell:  Bar-b-que, pork, sweet, smoke/peat!
Palate:  citrus, lemon/lime, orange, salt, brown sugar, 
Finish:  medium-long, smoke!, smooth, hint of melon?
Check it out!
A heavy Smokey peat aroma, like a campfire. The texture is not too oily. Overwhelmingly peaty with a cereal grain taste slight oak and vanilla. The finish is long and will stay with you for a while
Pop variety of island whiskey. As it should be
Straight up smokey and a little hot. I’m not getting much of the fruit notes that others have described. Not bad for a cheap pour.
Big, heavy, full nose.  Floral.  Dry, short finish.
When ur beyond excited for lockdown!
Terrific value. Peat, butterscotch, pear. I will buy again
For the price? Hard to do better
Too much smoke, without a fundamentally good scotch beneath it.

Smokey, bonfires, salty, phenolic, like pinetarsal, but in a good way. Reminds me of South Coast Islay. Some sweetness, like lightly caramelised sugar. I am enjoying this. Ticks the boxes for me. Would definitely buy again.
